image.altText: A ship crew member stands on a submarine with the US flag in the background

props.synopsis: Experts weigh in on plans for low-level radioactive waste to be stationed at a Perth defence base, as the Premier suggests it can be sent elsewhere.

title.children: Radioactive waste from nuclear AUKUS submarines will be stored in Perth. Is there any cause for concern?

image.altText: A blue and white sign with the initials 'FMG' on it.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest mining companies settles a dispute with WA's workplace safety regulator over whether it had to hand over documents relating to sexual harassment at three of its mine sites.

title.children: FMG settles dispute over sexual harassment documents, pledges to improve culture among executives

image.altText: A man and a woman stand outside a court building wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Michael Johnson died in 2020 at the Whirling Dervish mine, 120 kilometres from Kalgoorlie, after he fell 25 metres in a vehicle.

title.children: Perth parents slam fines against two companies over son's death at mine site

image.altText: An aerial shot of a sprawling mine in a forest

props.synopsis: WA's environmental watchdog will look at Alcoa's bauxite operations, south of Perth, amid concerns about the impact of its mining on drinking water, jarrah forests and animals that live in the area.

title.children: 'Rigorous' environmental review of US mining giant Alcoa's sprawling mines to probe Perth drinking water impact

image.altText: A woman and man on motorbikes, with blurred faces of their children riding with them.

props.synopsis: A couple who own a Moora-based livestock transport company had planned their attempted deception, a court has heard, but it just wasn't very well thought out.

title.children: Transport couple caught out by 'relatively unsophisticated' doctored invoices in cattle rustling case

image.altText: Two border guards escort a group of migrants carrying backpacks as they walk in the snow

props.synopsis: As Finland again shuts its border to Russia, Putin serves a reminder he is not afraid to pressure other states with promises of a military base near the border as he stands accused of a "hybrid operation" against the Baltic state.

title.children: While Putin continues his full-scale assault on Ukraine, Finland says a different type of threat is being tried on it

image.altText: For Sale signage outside a suburban house.

props.synopsis: House prices have gone from strength to strength in 2023, but some suburbs and regional areas saw median values decline by more than 10 per cent in the past 12 months after home buying demand dropped off after the pandemic.

title.children: House prices set a new record high every month this year — but some suburbs saw property values go backwards

image.altText: Large group of people, wet, standing on outside deck

props.synopsis: A group of North Queensland locals braved driving rains and rising floodwaters to rescue 17 people trapped in trees and from the rooftop of a pub.

title.children: 18 lives saved from rising floodwaters in Far North Queensland by a boatie named Gavin and a pilot named Magoo

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks at a lectern

props.synopsis: Premier Roger Cook says moving away from all public sector workers being offered the same pay rises will deliver greater flexibility in the bargaining process.

title.children: No more equal pay rises for WA public sector workers as individual union negotiations return

image.altText: Woman in purple dress sitting on seat outside house with stone featuring patting cream coloured dog, doghouse in left corner.

props.synopsis: South Australia ranks worst in the country in a national tradie shortage that's keeping critical state housing empty, as vulnerable people face a bleak Christmas with no home to call their own.

title.children: Ally is at the top of the rental list in a town with 48 empty social houses, but she could be waiting three more years

image.altText: This photo provided by the North Korean government shows what it says is an intercontinental ballistic missile.

props.synopsis: Pyongyang has long relied on its nuclear arsenal and array of weapons to leverage their international position.

title.children: Solid fuel missiles add deadly edge to North Korean arsenal

image.altText: Bushfire burns orange and red on the horizon at night against the silhouette of a windmill, as stars twinkle above in a dark sky

props.synopsis: A bushfire in the Pilliga State Forest near Narrabri is threatening lives and properties in Bohena Creek between McCanns Road, Perimeter Road, Tomlinson Lane and the Newell Highway.

title.children: Residents told to seek shelter as NSW bushfire spanning 81,000 hectares upgraded to emergency level

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside court.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins's former chief of staff at Parliament House Fiona Brown was allowed to give evidence to Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial in a closed court session.

title.children: Former chief of staff says after meeting with Bruce Lehrmann, it entered her mind Brittany Higgins may have been raped

image.altText: a group of dresses on mannequin on display

props.synopsis: The dress worn in the 90s, along with a matching illustration, was estimated to sell for up to $300,000 in the Los Angeles auction.

title.children: A gown worn by Princess Diana sells for $1.4 million, 11 times its estimate

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: ACT police and emergency services were called to the Canberra zoo about 12:50pm Monday after reports of a disturbance, where they found the woman dead, apparently as a result of stab wounds, in a commercial kitchen area.

title.children: Canberra woman found dead from suspected stabbing at National Zoo and Aquarium

image.altText: A plane with Turkish Airlines branding flies over a dense cityscape.

props.synopsis: Transport Minister Catherine King quietly approves expanded services for Turkish Airlines, including flights to stop-over destinations, despite earlier rejecting a similar request made by Qatar.

title.children: Turkish Airlines approved for massive expansion of flights to and from Australia, following Qatar rejection

image.altText: kids lines up to buy bread

props.synopsis: Human Rights Watch says evidence indicates civilians in Gaza have been deliberately denied food and water for over two months, which constitutes a war crime.

title.children: Human Rights Watch accuses Israel of using starvation as a weapon in Gaza

image.altText: Two firefighters stand in front of big smoke blaze.

props.synopsis: A farmer says it is beyond him how firefighters were able to control a series of fires that police allege were deliberately lit at the weekend.

title.children: Police charge man over Midwest fires that tore through 2,000 hectares

image.altText: ADF deployed as severe weather continues to hit North Queensland

props.synopsis: As heavy rain starts to ease across north Queensland, and evacuations get underway, locals are wondering how a relatively low-level category cyclone turned into such chaos.

title.children: How a low-level cyclone caused Cairns's largest flood in more than a century

image.altText: Serbian President Aleksandar Vučić celebrates in his party headquarters

props.synopsis: Serbia's right-wing governing party claims a sweeping victory in a snap parliamentary election, although opposition parties and election monitors say thousands of unregistered voters were allowed to cast ballots.

title.children: Populist Serbian ruling party hails election win amid calls for protest

image.altText: Nine brown horses run across a largely open plain, in the distance there are mountains.

props.synopsis: A NSW upper house inquiry into the aerial shooting of brumbies in Kosciuszko National Park has been told that the choice of weapon was behind the high number of shots required to kill the horses.

title.children: Ballistics expert questions calibre of guns being used to cull brumbies in national park

image.altText: A close up photo of Natasha Fyles with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory opposition calls for the resignation of Chief Minister Natasha Fyles after it is revealed she has an undisclosed shareholding in a company that owns a mine in a remote NT community where locals hold concerns over the mine's health impacts.

title.children: Calls for NT chief minister to resign over undisclosed shares in company that owns NT mine

image.altText: two female students carrying handbags walk through a university campus. they are facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: Researchers who examined the experience of students leaving school and pursuing further education find young people are facing increasing pressure to attend university.

title.children: High school students 'burnt out' from increasing pressure to attend university

image.altText: An elderly caucasian in a blue suit, red tie, speaking into a microphone with an American flag in the background.

props.synopsis: Speaking at a rally in Nevada, Donald Trump also calls US President Joe Biden a "low-IQ individual" and the "worst, most incompetent and most corrupt president" in the history of the United States.

title.children: Trump promises 'largest deportation operation in American history' if elected

image.altText: Pakistan's former prime minister Imran Khan sits on a couch pointing in the air

props.synopsis: The jailed former prime minister of Pakistan gets around a media blackout and a ban on public gatherings by live streaming a speech voiced by AI, calling for his supporters to turn out in large numbers for upcoming elections.

title.children: Imran Khan gets around media blackout and ban on physical gatherings with AI-generated live stream

image.altText: A drone shot of a cat napping holding a salmon drawn with rice plants.

props.synopsis: A Thai rice farmer has worked with an artist and hundreds of helpers to turn his property into works of art.

title.children: Napping cats have taken over this Thailand rice farm

image.altText: A small cylindrical black speak-like object sits on a kitchen counter top.

props.synopsis: Researchers are investigating whether Amazon's Alexa, Apple's Siri or Google Home speakers should be used to detect violence in homes.

title.children: Smart speakers offer 'unprecedented opportunity' to tackle domestic violence, but raise ethical issues

image.altText: The exterior of the court, showing the sign and the crest.

props.synopsis: The man allegedly sexually assaulted the teenage girl in the stairwell of a popular Canberra nightclub before allegedly raping her outside in a laneway.

title.children: Irish man accused of raping 16-year-old in Canberra arrested while preparing to leave Australia

image.altText: hands typing on a laptop

props.synopsis: The new breed of investment and share trading apps targeting retail investors and self-managed super funds are convenient for some but a headache for others, including the corporate regulator, which has found mis-selling, mislabelling, and misleading disclosures, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: A million clients, almost $900b and high-risk assets: The trading wild west on ASIC's radar

image.altText: Two women wear traditional Hazara headscarves and clothing.

props.synopsis: Hazara women Zahra Anvari and Gol Nazari settled in Tasmania as refugees seven years ago after decades of persecution. But after a violent incident, the day-to-day fear of discrimination continues.

title.children: Attackers try to rip headscarfs from Hobart mother and daughter

image.altText: Sea turtle hatchling sitting in the palm of a man's hand

props.synopsis: The precarious location of a rare Mid North Coast loggerhead turtle nest prompted rescuers to act quickly to give any hatchlings the best chance of survival.

title.children: Rare loggerhead turtle eggs moved from path of dangerous king tides
